snippet: A persistent desire to own stocks requires a restoration of Old Normal economic conditions, and greater risk tolerance among investors, a shift that some analysts say is under way.
abstract: Some financial analysts say investors are shifting toward greater risk tolerance of stocks, but naysayers contend that preference for bonds will continue as long as the Federal Reserve keeps interest rates at extreme lows.
lead_paragraph: A persistent desire to own stocks requires a restoration of Old Normal economic conditions, and greater risk tolerance among investors, a shift that some analysts say is under way.

headline.seo: Wall Street Strategists See a Shift Back Into Stocks From Bonds
headline.main: Divining Which Way the Wind Is Blowing
headline.print_headline: Divining Which Way the Wind Is Blowing
